item.title: Git usage
item.author: 作者
item.description: Quick setup — if you’ve done this kind of thing before We recommend every repository include a README, LICENSE, and .gitignore. …or create a new repository on the command line 1 2 3 4 5 6 echo "# test" >> README.md git init git add README.md git commit -m "first commit" git remote add origin git@github.com:colinwke/test.git git push -u origin master …o

item.title: Git/Github user problem
item.author: 作者
item.description: Past few days, I create a new Github account for devloping, when I use Git pushing my work on Github, something go wrong. remote: Permission to USER1/REPOSITORY.git denied to USER2. the USER1 is my new github account, and the USER2 is my old github account. I tried a variety of methods, but did not work. when I skim through the problem Git’s famous “ERROR:
